[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 11:53:36.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer/commit/ad18f381bf8503672e3a02a038e51569bbc269df', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: Id77c1f647c6779ca8b91b12bb56b8ebe80db69c9
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: Id77c1f647c6779ca8b91b12bb56b8ebe80db69c9

deleted_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ item.oslomsg_setup_host }}" when: - "item.oslomsg_transport == 'rabbit'" block: - name: Add RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}" - name: Add RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ item.oslomsg_userid }}" password: "{{ item.oslomsg_password }}" vhost: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}"

subject: Do not remove MariaDB-server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-28 15:20:07.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/commit/270eccd82aedf240e5bcc52876b226808f104bba', 'message': 'Do not remove MariaDB-server

rpmquery --whatprovides mariadb-server

commit_message:
Do not remove MariaDB-server

Removing mariadb-server and mariadb-libs leads to
removing MariaDB-server and MariaDB-shared and its
dependencies
rpmquery --whatprovides mariadb-server
MariaDB-server-10.1.30-1.el7.centos.x86_64
rpmquery --whatprovides mariadb-libs
MariaDB-shared-10.1.30-1.el7.centos.x86_64

Which in turn shuts down the server.

Change-Id: I89df8f6b57b1ebe0ce96d63f193da35107d2bad9
Closes-Bug: #1762421
Related-Bug: #1742206
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/44/578844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create symlink for ironic-rootwrap when using venv

Without this fix, ironic-rootwrap command won't be found
in ironic user default PATH

Change-Id: I405add3ded3035c732a8227acda2437bf692cc95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/22/589422/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: "Use path in venv if using" set_fact: rootwrap_venv_dir: "{{ bifrost_venv_dir }}/bin" when: enable_venv | bool == true line: "ironic ALL = (root) NOPASSWD: {{ rootwrap_venv_dir | default(ironic_rootwrap_dir) }}/ironic-rootwrap /etc/ironic/rootwrap.conf *"

commit_message:
Expose MTU configuration options.

Under some baremetal setups, MTU is set to a
bigger value (9000, jumbo frames).

This commit adds a couple of options to allow
the MTU to be set at neutron and nova.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I6b38fab1ff37ee6d96ee8292613a00e0b55a9728
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/77/587077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Default network MTU settings veth_mtu: "9000" mtu: "1500"

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: Ied4df931d0464173649c39ac82253c541b195cb1

commit_message:
stestr 2.2: Avoid python 2.x runs

We're only pulling in the Python 3.x version of stestr, so
python 2.x tests will fail. Avoid running those

Change-Id: Ia0bbb26e92d8564c9f4388e0aede685e854cbd89

commit_message:
Switch the "snmp" hardware type to "noop" management

Support for "fake" is kept for backward compatibility and is deprecated.

Change-Id: Ibee573e660e2ba4204ecb68c8d80ad8d1e0b9a74
Story: #2003203
Task: #23361

commit_message:
Remove python-tripleoclient rocky branch

The stable/rocky branch should not have been created for this since it
is a cycle-trailing client and does not have the same client lib
deadline as other clients. The branch is being manually removed by the
infra team. This removes the branch details from the deliverable file so
it doesn't inadvertently get recreated and so the team can later create
the branch at the point where they are ready for it.

Change-Id: I1f0c3439d67772a74c5d98f9410363eec8ee903f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable also ambari by default in devstack

It should not impact the usual features of devstack,
but no reason to not enable it.
The old hdp plugin was removed but this one was never added.

Change-Id: Ie93948966b90e286eac401673e6704694bacf249

subject: Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 13:44:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/f277061607702fb2908f5a8df9dd3f1b9232c5ea', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I93071d66bf4ac219794e47e6bb9b01a074750091
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I93071d66bf4ac219794e47e6bb9b01a074750091
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/73/589473/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Remove PyPI downloads

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/
PyPI package download statistics is no longer maintained and thus
should be removed.

commit_message:
Reduce log level on CentOS by default

This overrides centos default values of printk logging
to a more "quiet" default, reducing IO in testing.

Change-Id: I62d2357152384b78d8371f2a714aa3313d77f3fd

commit_message:
Update workbook namespace to '' on migration

Namespaces for workbooks have been recently introduced by
I2c66b3961915f0f35a9c468eb6dd0c0c70995234. It adds the new column but
leave the default as NULL in the database, and doesn't update the old
workbooks. This makes old workbooks undeletable. This patch adds a new
migration updating the workbooks.

Change-Id: I91d272d65b7be29303372f93c0811c484795efbb
Closes-Bug: #1785833

commit_message:
Drop incorrect reference to heat_launch

I99ce8abde838f16cabefe641b107e55b508c2cf9 updated the failure message to
not actually be a template, however the undercloud was attempting to use
self.heat_launch when formatting the failure message. The heat_launch
code only exists in the TripleoDeploy so this leads to a misleading
error message during failures.

Change-Id: Ica15fe506c06a8557d27675e450646dc96c5e6c4
Closes-Bug: #1783389
(cherry picked from commit 2376fdf6fe380cfe609b5671b26f2b365dbb9b21)

commit_message:
Align roles file to become a normalized path

Extend the tripleo client Command class to fetch heat roles data
from a role file. That new class method is shared by many derived
classes afterwards and used for containers images preparations,
containerized overcloud, undercloud and standalone deployments.

Apply normalization to the roles_file in plan management and
preflight checks as well.

Change-Id: I7b35e117b9d12f1e5a51e2ee0465244692d33e33
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8f1caf7abf74fa418b0572aaed6aa6e8a9c5931a)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I1ee6655f8b857e2742903c883b96e763d270293c

subject: Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 13:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum/commit/d208e8fe462853627c323e3c7222ba5f4fe99744', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I4c9d86ffea74517a7ad50479e934bddf6c7f0e2d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I4c9d86ffea74517a7ad50479e934bddf6c7f0e2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum refs/changes/68/589468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/tasks/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup RPC MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_rpc | default(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_rpc_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" configure_priv: ".*" read_priv: ".*" write_priv: ".*" state: "present" force: true no_log: true - name: Setup Notify MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_notify | default(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_notify_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}" state: "present" - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}"
deleted_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ item.oslomsg_setup_host }}" when: - "item.oslomsg_transport == 'rabbit'" block: - name: Add RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}" - name: Add RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ item.oslomsg_userid }}" password: "{{ item.oslomsg_password }}" vhost: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}"

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for voluem v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: I2d715a8a63069da5cfe02fbc0992eccb7ba598a7
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

commit_message:
Adding 'logapi' in apidoc_excluded_paths for sphinx-docs job

Currently the job build failed because it requires some reference
from neutron master branch. Which is not released along with latest
neutron Rocky3.

This patch is igrore this path for temporarily and recover after
next neutron release.

Change-Id: I18bae753466be752ff9de879fc7205f806701ae4

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: If671a68bd26842dafb55996cdcb47bbb58e4a130
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_zun refs/changes/94/589494/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/tasks/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup RPC MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_rpc | default(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_rpc_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" configure_priv: ".*" read_priv: ".*" write_priv: ".*" state: "present" force: true no_log: true - name: Setup Notify MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_notify | default(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_notify_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}" state: "present" - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}"
deleted_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ item.oslomsg_setup_host }}" when: - "item.oslomsg_transport == 'rabbit'" block: - name: Add RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}" - name: Add RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ item.oslomsg_userid }}" password: "{{ item.oslomsg_password }}" vhost: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}"

subject: Drop incorrect reference to heat_launch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-01 15:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/undercloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/2376fdf6fe380cfe609b5671b26f2b365dbb9b21', 'message': 'Drop incorrect reference to heat_launch

I99ce8abde838f16cabefe641b107e55b508c2cf9 updated the failure message to
not actually be a template, however the undercloud was attempting to use
self.heat_launch when formatting the failure message. The heat_launch
code only exists in the TripleoDeploy so this leads to a misleading
error message during failures.

Change-Id: Ica15fe506c06a8557d27675e450646dc96c5e6c4
Closes-Bug: #1783389
'}]
commit_message:
Drop incorrect reference to heat_launch

I99ce8abde838f16cabefe641b107e55b508c2cf9 updated the failure message to
not actually be a template, however the undercloud was attempting to use
self.heat_launch when formatting the failure message. The heat_launch
code only exists in the TripleoDeploy so this leads to a misleading
error message during failures.

Change-Id: Ica15fe506c06a8557d27675e450646dc96c5e6c4
Closes-Bug: #1783389
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/57/587857/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.log.error(UNDERCLOUD_FAILURE_MESSAGE) self.log.error(UNDERCLOUD_FAILURE_MESSAGE)

commit_message:
Align roles file to become a normalized path

Extend the tripleo client Command class to fetch heat roles data
from a role file. That new class method is shared by many derived
classes afterwards and used for containers images preparations,
containerized overcloud, undercloud and standalone deployments.

Apply normalization to the roles_file in plan management and
preflight checks as well.

Change-Id: I7b35e117b9d12f1e5a51e2ee0465244692d33e33
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/04/572404/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'directory. May be an absolute path or the path relative ' ' to --templates') % constants.OVERCLOUD_ROLES_FILE

containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate

inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I9c5bac93b500db095ca5dbe1a9e8f25c0a33a460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/61/589461/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/tasks/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup RPC MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_rpc | default(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_rpc_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_rpc_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" - name: Add RPC RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_vhost }}" configure_priv: ".*" read_priv: ".*" write_priv: ".*" state: "present" force: true no_log: true - name: Setup Notify MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ _oslomsg_rpc_setup_host }}" when: - "(_oslomsg_configure_notify | default(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined))" - "(_oslomsg_notify_transport is defined) and (_oslomsg_notify_transport == 'rabbit')" tags: - common-rabbitmq block: - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}" state: "present" - name: Add Notify RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_userid }}" password: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_password }}" vhost: "{{ _oslomsg_notify_vhost }}"
deleted_lines: # https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/tree/sync/mq_setup.yml- name: Setup MQ Service (RabbitMQ) delegate_to: "{{ item.oslomsg_setup_host }}" when: - "item.oslomsg_transport == 'rabbit'" block: - name: Add RabbitMQ vhost rabbitmq_vhost: name: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}" - name: Add RabbitMQ user rabbitmq_user: user: "{{ item.oslomsg_userid }}" password: "{{ item.oslomsg_password }}" vhost: "{{ item.oslomsg_vhost }}"

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191

commit_message:
Fix server strings in reboot operation

The following message is shown currently in the reboot operation.

  Request to reboot server <Server: server1> has been accepted.

The server name string is a bit odd. So fix it as follows.

  Request to reboot server server1
  (ff79e91e-e2a7-4e0f-b4c3-7157676d43c9) has been accepted.

Change-Id: I62df4589dc950f69fdc23eafcbb5792e897cb635
Closes-Bug: #1785495

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Update openstackdocstheme, sphinx and reno versions at the same time.

Change-Id: I8454b83f6ef200f8c5d34bee8568831b1e8fa15e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cloudkittyclient refs/changes/45/586345/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deps = -r{toxinidir}/doc/requirements.txt commands = sphinx-build -W -b html doc/source doc/build/htmldeps = -r{toxinidir}/doc/requirements.txt

commit_message:
Remove unused --etherpad opt from list_weeks

Change I3cc38afd80eb41200c7269a3039e87f01156eaab switched this tool to
generate a yaml file for driving the release schedule page. That also
removed the ability to generate an etherpad formatted output, but the
option was not removed. This cleans up the unused option.

Change-Id: I2e1b8dcb92239e891ac27af8a503f901c835c808
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix libraries jobs

So that we run testing on puppet 4 and
puppet 5 for libraries where both are voting.

We are still having the job running the latest
puppet version unit tests but as non voting which
is the same as for the integration tests.

Also removes puppet 3 syntax and adds puppet 5.

Change-Id: I5f78c19922677265cac54a39b29d8b9111bf2b52

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I559062788264ed54b0a21b678f420f8d33d2c663

subject: Avoid cleaning up cached images when configured not to

commit_message:
Avoid cleaning up cached images when configured not to

This change ensure that we're honoring the "remove_unused_base_images"
config option, allowing deployers to disable the auto-removal of
old images.

Change-Id: I49a0a83ab34ca0b9da5d589aaa9006d169275b15
Closes-Bug: #1773342
(cherry picked from commit 7caef58be03cee448d5845628b59ddd669511b87)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/38/588238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import ddt@ddt.ddt @ddt.data(True, False) def test_age_and_verify_cached_images(self, remove_unused_base_images): self.flags(remove_unused_base_images=remove_unused_base_images) if remove_unused_base_images: self.imagecache._remove_if_old_image.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.FAKE_IMG2) else: self.imagecache._remove_if_old_image.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

subject: Pin beaker-puppet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-08 08:09:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/commit/92e860d43027878c040e0e169b9ecbb8afaeda64', 'message': "Pin beaker-puppet

Version 1.0.0 was just released which is
not compatible with older version of beaker
and beaker-rspec.

This causes issues on CentOS so we pin the
version to lower if the RUBY_VERSION is older.

The beaker tests for Ubuntu Bionic is working
correctly since it's using a newer version of
beaker-rspec and beaker (because it has a newer
version of ruby available).

Change-Id: Id8990e84177fd6255f6ab8dfaeb7e60b5c4e992e
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-08 09:13:51.000000000', 'files': ['puppet-openstack_spec_helper.gemspec'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/commit/0cc228b88acd8ddd6d25a89e4bea647d4ebf42fc', 'message': 'Pin beaker-puppet

Version 1.0.0 was just released which is
not compatible with older version of beaker
and beaker-rspec.

Change-Id: Id8990e84177fd6255f6ab8dfaeb7e60b5c4e992e
'}]
commit_message:
Pin beaker-puppet

Version 1.0.0 was just released which is
not compatible with older version of beaker
and beaker-rspec.

Change-Id: Id8990e84177fd6255f6ab8dfaeb7e60b5c4e992e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/50/589750/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: beaker_puppet_version = RUBY_VERSION < '2.1.8' ? '= 0.17.1' : '>= 1.0.0' spec.add_dependency 'beaker-puppet', beaker_puppet_version

subject: Add regression test for bug 1781880
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-19 10:57:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/25e3ccba03e61c1749f5121e59dd2a4da349e666', 'message': 'Add regression test for bug 1781880

In 0df91a7f799060cd2e9b8a0adac1efacb974bcb3 a comparison
between ``update_at`` field from services DB and update time
from memcache was added if the servergroup_driver is set to be
memcached.

This could be problematic if servergroup_driver=mc and
``enable_new_services`` option in /etc/nova/nova.conf
is set to be ``False`` at the same time, as the ``update_at``
field will always be ``Null`` in services DB.

This patch adds an regression test to show this bug.

Change-Id: I4f547813ba42a4b3e1d9a02bb0392ad2cb4637f9
Related-Bug: #1781880

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug 1781880

In 0df91a7f799060cd2e9b8a0adac1efacb974bcb3 a comparison
between ``update_at`` field from services DB and update time
from memcache was added if the servergroup_driver is set to be
memcached.

This could be problematic if servergroup_driver=mc and
``enable_new_services`` option in /etc/nova/nova.conf
is set to be ``False`` at the same time, as the ``update_at``
field will always be ``Null`` in services DB.

This patch adds an regression test to show this bug.

Change-Id: I4f547813ba42a4b3e1d9a02bb0392ad2cb4637f9
Related-Bug: #1781880

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from oslo_utils import timeutils from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional.api import client from nova.tests.unit import cast_as_call from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture class TestServiceGet(test.TestCase): REQUIRES_LOCKING = True @mock.patch('nova.cache_utils.get_memcached_client') def setUp(self, mgc_mock): super(TestServiceGet, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.flags(servicegroup_driver='mc') self.mc_client = mock.MagicMock() mgc_mock.return_value = self.mc_client retval = timeutils.utcnow() self.mc_client.get.return_value = retval api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) # The non-admin API client is fine to stay at 2.1 since it just creates # and deletes the server. self.api = api_fixture.api self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api self.compute = self.start_service('compute') self.useFixture(cast_as_call.CastAsCall(self)) def test_list_services(self): """Regression test for bug #1781880. If the servicegroup_driver is set to use memcached, and enable_new_services=False, the ``updated_at`` field of db records of newly added compute services will always be Null. Before fixing this bug, when listing services under the above mentioned condition, error will return as ``updated_at`` will be compared with the value got from the memcached server, and TypeError will be raised as NoneType cannot be compared with Datetime type. """ self.assertRaises(client.OpenStackApiException, self.admin_api.get_services)

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver qos policy same name

Don't try to rename QoS Policy Group to the name it already has.
This is an unnecessary operation, that fails on NetApp Api with
"Reason - 18339:Policy with new name already exists".

Closes-Bug: #1778761
Change-Id: Iad58131ca6b675a4577888e287cd4899ea257771

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ie8adf0637da408c45a3a833f26e80a4d0700f60e

subject: Fix stestr check for glance and keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-08 12:37:44.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/keystone/keystone.spec.j2', 'openstack/glance/glance.spec.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging/commit/0d07e63ae287bc8b5b0074865c12c87503ef5b4b', 'message': 'Fix stestr check for glance and keystone

Since the build requirements for these packages only use python3, stestr
is only installed for python3. However, when stestr runs it execs a
command that defaults to using the python2 interpreter[1]. This seems to
cause a problem in the SUSE build chroot since it incorrectly uses that
default and then fails to find the subunit module since it is only
installed for python3. This patch sets the PYTHON variable explicitly in
the stestr check to ensure it only tries to use python3.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/blob/2.1.0/stestr/config_file.py#L103

Change-Id: I8828b229045ad271b74a5f559d3ec40026447152
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stestr check for glance and keystone

Since the build requirements for these packages only use python3, stestr
is only installed for python3. However, when stestr runs it execs a
command that defaults to using the python2 interpreter[1]. This seems to
cause a problem in the SUSE build chroot since it incorrectly uses that
default and then fails to find the subunit module since it is only
installed for python3. This patch sets the PYTHON variable explicitly in
the stestr check to ensure it only tries to use python3.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/blob/2.1.0/stestr/config_file.py#L103

Change-Id: I8828b229045ad271b74a5f559d3ec40026447152
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/75/589875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OS_TEST_PATH=./glance/tests/unit PYTHONPATH=. PYTHON=python3 stestr run

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 11:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_barbican/commit/daecd5fd9d2dbc297446dd778ea7e45da29f680e', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I67ad9bdf03729f21778cc0d187495474a31784be

commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I077a267824b6142874d052d10227ea055abd6069

subject: Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 14:06:17.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_trove/commit/5333f1a75980efe4c3b74fdbec2534d11abbe3cd', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I320ae83839869ee89fa5db3bf5c55d245f3b17db
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I320ae83839869ee89fa5db3bf5c55d245f3b17db

commit_message:
Make role test-requirements.txt be additive

Some roles need to make use of extra requirements, but
only for tests. For example, the octavia role needs to
use the octavia client for some test tasks.

Instead of duplicating the whole test requirements file
in that repo, we change the mechanism to make it additive
so that the repo test-requirements are added into the
test runtime venv.

Change-Id: If670a32e79bfb4623fa427925cdc992219742d58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/48/589248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # it with the common one.# We add the common requirements after the in-repo requirements # so that the in-repo ones take precedence. PIP_OPTS+=" --requirement ${COMMON_TESTS_PATH}/test-requirements.txt"
deleted_lines: # it instead of the common one.else PIP_OPTS+=" --requirement ${COMMON_TESTS_PATH}/test-requirements.txt"

commit_message:
Add NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot and NovaResumeGuestsShutdownTimeout

NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot (true/false) parameter which
configures whether or not to start again instances which were running at
the time of a compute reboot.
This will set the resume_guests_state_on_host_boot parameter in nova.conf
and configures and enables libvirt-guests with a dependency to the
docker service to shutdown instances before the libvirt container gets
stopped.
NovaResumeGuestsShutdownTimeout specifies the number in seconds for an
instance to allow to shutdown.

Change-Id: I946600ebbc3afd88385ca89015e8f6a6c46f46ef
Closes-Bug: 1778216
Depends-On: I2766cdd66ff17756daaf1a75ad516a7af6eebddc
Depends-On: Id1cc2e75af316b864cebf601395f1111b7fb049a

commit_message:
Add jmespath to requirements.txt

Adding this python library enables us to use the
json_query filter, which is amazing, and deserves
to be president.

commit_message:
Neutron-api checks shared-db before OS migration

Migrating OpenStack versions without correct database set up for
neutron-api may cause it to crash.
To avoid that, when OpenStack migration is demanded, the charm must
wait for a shared-db to be available before moving data with
neutron-db-manage command

Change-Id: Id778d41ffad1b9648e3e81da8d2bf5cdb2e4a908
Closes-Bug: #1785839

commit_message:
Fix resize revert to use non-legacy alloc handling

During the revert of resize or migrate nova tries to drop the
allocation on the target host. But first it decides if the resize uses
the new style allocation handling where the source host allocation is
held by the migration. If not then the legacy double-up allocation
handling is triggered.

However the implementation tried to check if the migration holds
allocation on the destination host and that is clearly wrong as migration
only holds alloction on the source host.

This patch now changes the check to simply assert if there is any
allocation held by the migration.uuid.

Change-Id: I41c10ca5caa01dda950dd17319889963850fed59
Closes-Bug: #1785776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/589425/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: allocs = self.reportclient.get_allocations_for_consumer( context, migration.uuid)

commit_message:
Cap the api_extensions for tempest config

This commit cap the api_extensions config options
for cinder, neutron and swift.

api_extensions config option on tempest side is default to 'all' [1]
which means all extensions are enabled on gate. Tempest test are
skipped based on extensions availability in api_extensions config
options.

On master, each project keep updating(adding or removing) their
extensions lists which will not be present on stable branches, 
so we need to cap the api_extensions on devstack side
to configure the Tempest for stable branch.

This way we enable Tempest to run on stable branch gate with actual
extensions present on that branch not with 'all'

Currently cinder, swift and neutron have extensions concept.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/25572c3b5512aa3ecc949b926af1e1fd64fddfd9/tempest/config.py#L646

Change-Id: I0705f551e684a202802cb87104ca186ed7fc1a3f

commit_message:
zun: set docker api version to 1.24

Kolla is using Docker API version 1.24 but the default is 1.26
in Zun. We need to configure it to 1.24 so that Zun and Kolla
can work together.

Partial-Bug: #1782055
Change-Id: I072dccc06fe35dccf25068ef0ca8f39cad9fdc60

commit_message:
Support configuration groups for clusters

Handles API part implemented in change:
I7c0a22c6a0287128d0c37e100589c78173fd9c1a

So far passing configuration group was possible only for single instance
deployment.

As the trove api now already supports configuration attach and detach
for clusters, we are able to handle it in client.

Configuration will be applied to each cluster instance.

Partially implements: blueprint cluster-configuration-groups
Change-Id: Ic0840c995cbc34203c76494d7ba522f3e17141a7
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

commit_message:
[UDP] Fix failed member always in DRAIN status

1. Remove 'inhibit_on_failure' option from realserver configuration block.
   Then when the member is failed which means the MISC_CHECK is failed,
   the amp agent can not get the member info from kernel ip_vs file, and
   it will return status DOWN to health manger, then the member status
   will be ERROR, and its associated pool and loadbalancer will be in
   DEGRADED status.

Alternative:
Using notify_up/notify_down to write the status into a member specific
file, then we can read the member status from that file directly.

Change-Id: I940681b8109b05334ebb5befc58b43f08d2a1148
Story: 2003198
Task: 23354

commit_message:
Followup patch for UDP support

1. Removes the misc_dynamic setting from the UDP-CONNECT health monitor
   as our script does not use it.
2. Adds a release note for the UDP features.
3. Updates the API reference for UDP support.
4. Adds a comment to the keepalived config with the LB ID.
5. Updates the status message type to be the correct UDP protocol.
6. Fix error during deleting a listener if there are multiple amphoraes.
7. Refactors systemd service script handling.

Story: 2003306
Task: 24258
Change-Id: I09240023d066ac5a71836d01045cda6ce5678712

Change-Id: I3e3f4d006381766f8882af1617038bd2e91dfbb5

commit_message:
Template delete-validate uuid format

 check input for valid uuid format before query.

Change-Id: I3e3f4d006381766f8882af1617038bd2e91dfbb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-vitrageclient refs/changes/73/574073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re import argparse parser.add_argument('uuid', help='ID of a template', nargs='+', type=TemplateDelete.vaild_uuid) @staticmethod def vaild_uuid(uuids): rege = '^[a-z0-9]{8}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{4}-[a-z0-9]{12}$' if type(uuids) != list: uuids = [uuids] for uuid in uuids: if not re.match(rege, uuid): raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError("Not a uuid format") return uuids
deleted_lines: parser.add_argument('uuid', help='ID of a template', nargs='+')

commit_message:
NEC driver: loss of access after live-migration

In Cinder API v3.44 and later, remove_export() is called after
live-migration. In remove_export(), NEC driver detaches the given
volume from all servers. Then the migrated instance on the destination
server loses access to its volumes.
Basically NEC driver detaches volume in terminate_connection().
The detach-from-all is needed only when an attached volume is deleted
before detach.
This patch moves the detach-from-all from remove_export() to
delete_volume().

Closes-Bug: #1777385
Change-Id: I7d9398dadca7115ad58040743a55601a592f2fa3
(cherry picked from commit 620e1b7613316e271be0d0aef2e037eff0f6f888)

commit_message:
fix ironic driver data structure usage

The template would previously split strings so you'd get things like

enabled_hardware_types = p,x,e

Now we use jmespath to do the search of the lists/dicts for us.

Change-Id: I3f2f4550ed47b78c20d603d77124609c1ec2a63d

subject: Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-07 13:57:04.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/mq_setup.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia/commit/53c00a0aeca992678aaadeee7ac8da9c9ed5fe33', 'message': "Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I02dc040c270643906b63c3218bdfcfceed91b544
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tags to be used for MQ tasks

The use of 'include_tasks' and a loop of variables creates
a situation where a user is unable to use tags to scope the
inclusion of only the MQ tasks when running the playbooks.

The use-case this is important for is when the rabbitmq
containers are destroyed and rebuilt in order to resolve
an issue with them, and the user wishes to quickly recreate
all the vhosts/users.

Ansible's 'include_tasks' is a dynamic inclusion, and dynamic
inclusions are not included when using tags. The nice thing
about dynamic inclusions is that they completely skip all
tasks when the condition does not apply, cutting down deploy
time. However, given the use-case, we should rather take on
the extra deployment time.

This patch changes the dynamic inclusion to a static one,
adds a 'common-mq' tag to cover all MQ implementations,
and re-implements the 'common-rabbitmq' tag for the tasks
that relate to RabbitMQ specifically.

It also implements conditionals for each task set so that
the rpc/notify tasks can be skipped if a vhost/user is not
required for that purpose (eg: swift does not use RPC, and
most roles will not use notifications by default).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/588191
Change-Id: I02dc040c270643906b63c3218bdfcfceed91b544

commit_message:
Remove usage of future library

*future* library is not listed in global-requirements and should not be
used. This commit removes all its occurences and replaces with
oslo_utils.encodeutils module.

Change-Id: I5d0795a1a894c103422f7d63f5d76b29ea6d15a4
Story: 2003193
Task: 23360

commit_message:
[docs] Add documentation for 'install_method' variable

The 'install_method' variable can be used to deploy OpenStack services
either from source or from distribution packages. Since this variable
is meant to be set during the initial deployment and can't be changed
afterwards, it is important to document it in order to let deployers
know about it.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: I59fe66a5cef45487afbfc090aca93cb567427f7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/589398/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Deployers can now set the ``install_method`` to either ``source`` (default) or ``distro`` to choose the method that the OpenStack services will be deployed on the hosts. This only affects *new* deployments and existing deployments, which are all sourced based ones, can't be converted to the new ``distro`` method. For more information, please refer to the `Deployment Guide <https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/openstack-ansible>`_.

commit_message:
Update the default admission control list

The recommended admission controller list is:
NamespaceLifecycle,LimitRanger,ServiceAccount,DefaultStorageClass,
DefaultTolerationSeconds,MutatingAdmissionWebhook,
ValidatingAdmissionWebhook,ResourceQuota

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/admission-controllers/#is-there-a-recommended-set-of-admission-controllers-to-use

Change-Id: I663804d93d5ff8dc70171bcd7d61b2d92c8616e1
(cherry picked from commit ae158f3efa9b253b1c4e898f4c69e776cad13c4d)

commit_message:
Split zuul.yaml into multiple files

With the current increase of zuul jobs and
service testing, is easier to maintain and
control what changes are done in different files.

Ideally jobs.yaml would be split into multiple files,
in example per distro, install type, aio or multinode,
etc

Change-Id: I78d3f1f00f96ef3042e94bba6b19e61d7fff4203

commit_message:
Whitelist Octavia API

Octavia API should be accessible from the outside and not whitelisted
just like other "outside accessible" services (nova-api, cinder-api, etc)

Change-Id: I6b011d71718cbd1fb846cd33be4caf266df7849d
(cherry picked from commit 342f48c5363beabe215d44bb507cb2ec9d732f65)

commit_message:
Docs: Autogenerate config documentation

Ensure the documentation is kept up to date by automatically
generating it from the source when the docs are built.

This patch:
1.replace oslosphinx with openstackdocstheme since oslosphinx is obsolete
2.add oslo_config.sphinxconfiggen to generate sample conf file
3.add oslo_policy.sphinxpolicygen to generate sample policy file

Change-Id: I39f03023f0a85e4c8943925268ab3e9066975630
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/80/588480/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ==================== Cyborg Sample Policy ==================== The following is a sample cyborg policy file that has been auto-generated from default policy values in code. If you're using the default policies, then the maintenance of this file is not necessary, and it should not be copied into a deployment. Doing so will result in duplicate policy definitions. It is here to help explain which policy operations protect specific cyborg APIs, but it is not suggested to copy and paste into a deployment unless you're planning on providing a different policy for an operation that is not the default. If you wish build a policy file, you can also use ``tox -e genpolicy`` to generate it. The sample policy file can also be downloaded in `file form </_static/cyborg.policy.yaml.sample>`_. .. literalinclude:: /_static/cyborg.policy.yaml.sample

commit_message:
api-ref: Add descriptions for rebuild

Add descriptions about specifying a new image and
asynchronous postconditions in the rebuild operation
in the compute API reference.

Change-Id: I0fd136d07dffc2be845b4b9330fae98c7115789b
Closes-Bug: #1784387
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/588931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This operation recreates a root disk of the server. For a volume-backed server, this operation keeps contents of the volume. **Asynchronous Postconditions** After you successfully rebuild a server, its status changes to ``ACTIVE`` if its status is ``ACTIVE`` before the rebuild operation. Its status changes to ``SHUTOFF`` if its status is ``SHUTOFF`` before the rebuild operation. If an error occurrs during the rebuild operation, its status changes to ``ERROR``.

subject: Add 'symmetrical' as property of a forwarding path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-25 06:36:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/30916a7acae09ea31712a0bce1dc4d67d271308e', 'message': "Add 'symmetric' as property of a forwarding path

When Network Service (NS) is supported in Tacker, we can launch
multiple VNFFGs by initiating NS. Because each VNFFG can have
different 'symmetrical' value, we should support dynamic 'symmetrical'
parameter for each VNFFG in VNFFG descriptor.

This feature will add 'symmetric' as a property of forwarding path,
so users can set 'symmetric' value to 'true' or 'false' to change
symmetrical value of a port chain in networking-sfc.

Change-Id: Ie9a6abe96141954e95902cd426abafa10d744236

commit_message:
Add 'symmetrical' as property of a forwarding path

When Network Service (NS) is supported in Tacker, we can launch
multiple VNFFGs by initiating NS. Because each VNFFG can have
different 'symmetrical' value, we should support dynamic 'symmetrical'
parameter for each VNFFG in VNFFG descriptor.

This feature will add 'symmetrical' as a property of forwarding path,
so users can set 'symmetrical' value to 'true' or 'false' to change
symmetrical value of a port chain in networking-sfc.

Change-Id: Ie9a6abe96141954e95902cd426abafa10d744236

commit_message:
Use distribution packages for pip

All supported distributions now provide a recent
enough version of pip to suit all our source
build/install needs.

Change-Id: I6ef77bf82f64004b2d3a8f751b4dbba4baf7764b
